content: if only one number is given it applies to all sizes links to video tutorials draw up stitches and secure https //youtu be/bwdksvzx3mc mattress stitch https //youtu be/jggyklr4hoy weaving in yarn ends over rib stitch https //youtu be/pyehpnamxke weaving in yarn ends over stocking stitch https //youtu be/7wg-8gdxaqs these and other tutorials are also available on my website here overview the mittens are knit flat folded in half vertically and seamed along one side you cast on at the cuff edge and work a section of 2x2 rib which will will be folded in half when the mittens are worn the body of the mitten is knit in stocking stitch with thumbs added for the largest size finally you work a short section of decreases at the end to shape the mitten across the finger tips safety please ensure you have firmly secured seams and yarn ends and have removed any stitch holder pins or clips used in seaming before gifting or allowing the mittens to be worn mittens are a potential choking hazard babies should not be left unattended when wearing mittens selling items using this pattern you may make items to sell using this pattern under the following conditions items must be handknit by the person who purchased the pattern you as the maker are 100% responsible for ensuring your item is safely made following the legislation and safety standards in the country you are selling the item to it is your responsibility to pass safety information on to the buyer of your handknit items eg do not leave a baby unattended whilst wearing a baby hat 3 lf049 baby & toddler mittens -
